James T. Kirk.Action: Orders to assist the crippled Kobayashi Maru despite the risk of entering the Neutral Zone, showing concern for the distressed vessel and its people.
Orders to intercept the Kobayashi Maru distress call despite the risk of entering the Neutral Zone.
Does not hesitate or show doubt when deciding to approach the ship in distress.
Fails to heed the warning from Sulu about the risks of entering the Neutral Zone, potentially underestimating the dangers.
Does not appear or act in this excerpt; leadership and command are delegated to Saavik and others in a crisis situation.
Jokes with Bones about healing himself after injury.
Encourages Saavik to be candid about her feelings and listens.
Uses a somewhat sarcastic tone when responding to Bones, may indicate limited emotional support in moment of stress.
Acknowledges the harsh reality to Saavik, teaching command responsibility and realism.
Encourages Saavik to think about death and life, engaging her in personal reflection.
Dismisses concerns about crew in a somewhat dismissive, age-related comment to Bones.
Makes a dry joke to Spock about being dead, indicating familiarity and a friendly tone.
Acknowledges Spock's comment about his unique Kobayashi Maru solution with somber respect.
Refers to Saavik as emotional in a possibly critical, but understanding manner.
Thanks Spock for the gift, engages in friendly, albeit somewhat uncomfortable, conversation.
Responds shortly and somewhat guarded when asked about his plans and feelings.
Lives as a loner with few possessions but keeps a collection of antiques.
Described as 'many things, but he was never a Boy Scout' by Carol, implying a complex, perhaps pragmatic nature rather than naive idealism.
Reads a novel in his apartment, appearing distracted and trying to focus.
Recognizes Romulan Ale as illegal but accepts it with good humor and camaraderie.
Shows curiosity and willingness to try new things (wears the antique glasses), responds positively to doctor's explanation.
Struggles to read the label initially, indicating some difficulty with small print or details.
Does not immediately understand how the glasses function and is unsure how they work.
Responds curtly to Bones' concern and resists emotional openness.
Invites Bones to be direct about his feelings, showing some openness to sincere communication.
Avoids confronting his own feelings and duties openly; pours a drink instead of engaging directly.
Uses rules and regulations as a shield to hide from personal challenges and desires.
Listens to honest feedback from Bones and invites candid opinion.
Does not appear or act directly in this excerpt; no demonstrated competence or incompetence shown.
No direct actions or statements by Kirk in this excerpt.
Chekov urgently alerts Kirk about danger; Kirk presumably trusts his subordinate's assessment implicitly.
His past action of marooning Khan and his crew on Ceti Alpha V is referenced; implies assertive command decisions and strategic actions.
No direct action or decision seen in this excerpt; others respond to consequences of his past decisions.
Sent seventy people, including Khan and his followers, into exile on a barren planet without checking on their progress.
Failed to check on the welfare of the exiled group despite the harsh conditions leading to their suffering and death.
Previously offered hospitality to Khan and his followers, though it was repaid with betrayal.
Sent seventy people, including Khan and his followers, into exile on a barren planet without follow-up checks, leading to their suffering and near death.
Despite the exile, managed to maintain a long-term mission and command, with an implication of decisive leadership over difficult choices.
Captured indirectly in this scene, with no direct action shown; others defend his intentions (Chekov speaks on his behalf)
Thanks Sulu sincerely, acknowledges his new command with personal attention.
Sits reading quietly on shuttle, a calm and composed presence.
Encourages Sulu warmly, expressing gratitude and confidence in him despite joking about the kids' steering abilities.
Makes a dry joke about having gone through death and life with Saavik, which causes her to stiffen.
Gives a friendly and familiar greeting to Scotty, calling him 'old space dog' and asking about his health.
Responds with amusement and returns salute warmly to a nervous young Midshipman.
Engages and speaks directly and encouragingly to a young midshipman, showing interest in his first training voyage.
Playfully teases Midshipman Preston but ends with an approving comment calling him 'a tiger.'
Engages the team with good-natured humor, lightening the mood during inspection.
Sternly challenges Preston initially, demonstrating high standards but not harshness.
Tries to conceal his reaction to Saavik's inexperience, watches supportively like a father watching his kid drive the family car for the first time.
Tries to conceal his reaction to Saavik's inexperience and responds casually; supports a new pilot gaining experience.
Allows Spock to command Saavik despite her inexperience, showing trust in chain of command and team skills.
Starts to say something, then wisely chooses to remain silent; accepts Bones' offer of a tranquilizer but declines, showing self-control and awareness.
Allows Spock to take charge of the course heading with a smile, showing trust and tolerance toward his crew.
Pauses before speaking, takes a breath, calmly assesses the situation before giving discretionary command.
Declines an offered tranquilizer despite appearing tense, indicating control over his nerves.
Allows Spock to interpret and execute navigational commands under his discretion, demonstrating trust but also delegation.
Is identified as having access to classified information due to his position on the Fleet General Staff.
Has his plans and actions considered worthy of strategic pursuit and challenge by Khan, implying recognition of his skill and intellect.
Issues sudden order to transfer Project Genesis materials to the USS Reliant without consultation, disrupting a civilian project under Carol Marcus's control.
Issues direct orders from Starfleet command authorizing immediate transfer and testing of Project Genesis materials, showing command authority and decisiveness.
Orders are perceived as irregular and provoke consternation among Project Genesis scientists, suggesting possible lack of communication or poor coordination with civilians involved.
Issues orders to seize the Genesis Project despite opposition from scientific staff.
Issues orders authorizing Commander Chekov to take control of the Genesis project, demonstrating decisiveness and command authority.
Orders cause confusion and conflict between scientists and Starfleet personnel, suggesting a possible lack of communication or foresight about the impact of his commands.
Acknowledges Saavik's concern and reassures her about the Kobayashi Maru test with humor and encouragement.
Makes a teasing remark about Saavik's hairstyle being regulation, showing light-hearted engagement.
Uses sarcasm ('She's a laugh a minute...') in an amused, somewhat dismissive way toward Saavik's difficulty with humor.
Acknowledges Saavik's concerns about her Kobayashi Maru test performance and reassures her by explaining the nature of the test as character-based rather than a scenario to 'win'.
Demonstrates confidence and calm demeanor while interacting with Saavik in the turbo lift, showing ability to maintain composure in small social interactions.
Uses humor deliberately to ease tension and communicate insights about the Kobayashi Maru test.
Engages in a thoughtful exchange that shows understanding of leadership and training challenges (addressing Saavik's insecurities).
No evident failures, lapses, or mistakes in this excerpt; behavior is steady and skillful.
Thanks Saavik politely when she exits the elevator.
Remains silent when Bones comments on Saavik's hairstyle and Romulan ale, showing restraint and tolerance.
Acknowledges the danger of re-opening old wounds in response to Bones' joke, showing empathy and insight.
Shows frustration and concern while trying to communicate with Carol Marcus over an unstable video link.
Pushes the elevator button to initiate movement, calmly interacts with Saavik and Bones.
Communicates promptly and clearly with Uhura about receiving an urgent message.
Responds appropriately to a difficult communication situation with Dr. Carol Marcus, showing patience and attentiveness despite interference.
Studies the ceiling silently when questioned about Saavik's appearance, avoiding a direct answer.

Responds with concern and urgency to Carol's distress about Genesis being taken away, expresses frustration at communication failure, immediately takes command and initiates actions to address the emergency.
Quickly takes command of the ship in an emergency, issues clear orders to stop engines and plot a new course, and coordinates with crew effectively.
Expresses visible frustration when losing communication and when transmission is jammed, pounding the comm in frustration.
Responds to Spock's declaration of friendship with visible emotion and invites him to accompany him to the bridge.
Expresses confusion and concern about the message to 'give up Genesis,' showing engagement and earnestness in the situation.
Requests Dr. McCoy (Bones) to join him in his quarters, involving trusted colleagues in a confidential matter.
Uses security clearance procedure efficiently and respectfully, does not show arrogance or dismissiveness.
Engages attentively with Carol Marcus' explanation of Project Genesis, indicating respect and openness to others' expertise.
Efficiently and confidently gains high-level security clearance and immediately accesses critical Project Genesis data using proper protocols.
Quickly organizes a meeting with relevant officers (McCoy, Saavik) to address an urgent and complex situation, showing leadership and decisiveness.
Reacted with wonder to the Genesis effect demonstration alongside Bones and Spock, showing openness and genuine interest.
Engages with colleagues in thoughtful and respectful manner during demonstration.
Shows attentive observation and reacts with wonder to the Genesis demonstration alongside Bones and Spock.
Engages in quick, insightful dialogue with Spock about the implications of the Genesis device and the timing of experiments.
Interrupts the heated argument between Bones and Spock attempting to moderate the conversation ('Gentlemen, this isn't --')
Shows concern about the arriving vessel and recognizes crew members aboard it (asks about Chekov)
Intervenes to moderate a heated debate between Spock and Bones, trying to restore order and focus.
Quickly responds to an urgent sensor alert indicating an unknown vessel approaching, showing situational awareness.
Questions the identity and intent of the approaching vessel Reliant, showing concern and attention to crew safety.
Attempts communication with Reliant through emergency channels when normal communication fails.
Attempts to communicate with Reliant despite no response, expresses concern about their COMM system failure.
Issues Yellow alert and orders defense fields energized, preparing for possible battle.
Commands to raise shields and energize phasers promptly upon threat detection.
Urgently directs defensive measures in a crisis, showing responsibility toward crew safety.
Orders to raise shields and energize phasers promptly when enemy ships lock weapons.
Interrupts his command as the attack hits, implying a possibly reactive rather than fully anticipatory posture.
Commands clearly and authoritatively to manage the crisis, tells Uhura to turn off distracting channels to focus on Scotty's report.
Maintains command presence under crisis, directing crew efficiently (e.g., ordering Sulu on shields, cutting off distracting channels, directly coordinating with Scotty).
Does not panic amid chaos, quickly prioritizes communication and response despite limited information.
Directs crew calmly under attack and coordinates defense efforts.
Acknowledges surrender communication to negotiate terms, showing respect for adversary's message.
Looks to his crew for support and shares a moment of connection (eye contact with Spock and Saavik) before responding.
Quickly assesses the situation after a surprise attack and orders phaser fire despite insufficient power.
Requests status updates promptly (Scotty about power, decision to communicate with Reliant).
Decides to communicate with the enemy while under heavy damage and precarious conditions, showing presence of mind.
Expresses confusion and surprise upon seeing Khan, momentarily dumbfounded.
Urgently encourages his team and tries to reason with Khan, asking for time and expressing his attempts to negotiate even under pressure.
Shows impatience by sharply ordering Saavik to hurry.
Explains technical details patiently to Saavik, trying to educate her.
Expresses mistrust toward Khan and questions him sternly about keeping his word.
Commands crew calmly under pressure, directs a coordinated attack on the enemy ship, showing control and trust in his team
Maintains dry, restrained tone despite tense situation, not showing overt emotion or encouragement
Commands Sulu to lock phasers and waits for the right moment to fire; acts decisively under pressure, leading to heavy damage inflicted on the Reliant.
Remains calm and confident while enemy shields drop and the crew struggles, demonstrating control and strong leadership in battle.
Admits to having been caught off-guard and making mistakes, showing self-awareness but also frustration and some loss of control.
Immediately refocuses on assessing the situation and determining the extent of damage, demonstrating leadership and a proactive mindset.
Visits sickbay personally, interacts compassionately with injured crew and the dying Midshipman Preston, showing presence of mind and emotional leadership under crisis.
Acknowledges Scotty's efforts and shows concern by asking if he's all right and expressing thanks.
Keeps focus on the mission despite loss, accepts responsibility by admitting he got beat and credits crew's survival to his knowledge.
Shows no visible frustration or blame toward Bones after the loss; maintains professional composure.
Hits the intercom to communicate quickly with Spock, demonstrating decisiveness but no overt friendliness or warmth in interaction.
Acknowledges enemy's motive clearly and stays focused on mission priorities despite emotional stress.
Asks Scotty practical questions about power restoration and works with engineering status to proceed with best available options.
Admits frankly that he was beaten and credits knowledge of the ship as the reason for survival.
Attempts to communicate repeatedly with the space station; shows concern for his crew and situation.
Uses irony ('Blind as a Tiberian Bat') in a tense situation.
Remains calm and attempts communication with the space station multiple times despite no initial response.
Acknowledges limitations in sensor data and lack of information, demonstrates situational awareness.
Uses irony to comment on the situation, showing confidence under pressure.
Shows concern about enemy ship possibly hiding, indicating strategic thinking.
Decides to personally go down to the station despite potential danger, showing decisiveness and willingness to take responsibility.
Challenges Saavik's incorrect citation of a regulation, demonstrating confidence and knowledge of rules.
Delegates command of the ship to Spock and orders systematic actions, reflecting good leadership and command skills.
Equips himself and team with appropriate tools and weapons before proceeding, indicating thorough preparation and caution.
Moves cautiously into an unknown, potentially dangerous environment but still takes initiative to explore and find survivors, balancing risk and mission goals.
Helps Bones cut down the hanged bodies despite the grim situation.
Looks around despairingly after seeing the corpses, showing emotional response to the loss.
Helps Bones cut down the last of the five bodies and examines corpses to gather information.
Looks around despairingly upon recognizing the fate of Carol and the crew, showing emotional impact.
Holds and comforts Chekov as he weeps, providing reassurance in a moment of high anxiety.
Urgently asks Saavik to inform Uhura they are safe, showing concern for others’ peace of mind.
Responds calmly and gently to Chekov’s distress, encouraging him to share information.
Comforts Chekov emotionally when he is distressed and anxious, demonstrating calm leadership and empathy.
Shows concern and urgency in directing Saavik to confirm the crew's status, acting decisively under pressure.
Allows Bones to take over the medical assessment and treatment without interference, trusting his expert colleagues appropriately.
Looks at Chekov compassionately as he breaks into tears.
Seriously considers the situation with concern and thoughtfulness (ponders, thinks).
Inquires calmly about the whereabouts and fate of others.
Quickly assesses the situation about missing Genesis materials and tortured scientists, showing situational awareness and ability to piece together events.
Raises logical questions about where the transporter room is and whether Khan made it down, demonstrating curiosity and tactical thinking under pressure.
Shows thoughtful reflection on Khan's motives and his own culpability, indicating emotional intelligence to complement competence.
No indication of indecision, panic, or confusion despite intense and dangerous circumstances.
Acknowledges sacrifice of others by saying they bought escape time with their lives.
Shows concern and quickly processes complex information to protect his crew.
Gives clear orders to Spock prioritizing crew safety and communication.
Dismisses Uhura's emotional concern firmly but practically to maintain command control.
Allows Terrell and Chekov to share the risk despite hesitation.
Attempts a lighthearted comment to Bones about 'getting away from it all' despite danger.
Does not react aggressively when attacked by David, maintaining composure.
Agrees to share the risk with his crew despite initial hesitation, then leads the team confidently onto the pod for transport.
Shows situational awareness by pointing to where Saavik is heading and maintaining calm when uncertain about their destination.
Is quickly overpowered and tackled to the ground by David, with a knife at his throat, suggesting a momentary failure to anticipate or prevent an ambush.
Walks toward Carol to embrace her despite the tense situation, showing emotional vulnerability by holding her tightly and looking stunned
Questions Carol gently about why she didn't tell him the truth, indicating trust and openness to reconciliation
Stands there stunned looking back at David, showing hesitation and restraint rather than aggression
Does not react aggressively when David threatens to kill him, avoiding escalation
Remains unsurprised and composed when Khan orders his death, showing steadiness that can reassure others.
Does not intervene directly when Terrell is conflicted and when others around are panicked or in danger, showing possible omission in offering comfort or leadership at a critical moment.
Remains unsurprised and mentally prepared for Khan's order to kill him, showing confidence and alertness.
Does not actively intervene to prevent the chaos surrounding Terrell, David, Saavik, and Chekov, despite the tense and dangerous situation.
Desperately tries to reason with Khan, expressing concern despite being in danger.
Desperately challenges Khan despite being desperate and outmatched, trying to assert control of the situation verbally.
Takes Chekov's hand when he tries to smile despite injury.
Mentions survival pragmatically but maintains calm in tense situation.
Unruffled when others are anxious, insists on staying put for now.
Calmly focuses on survival and practical needs like eating despite the crisis.
Acknowledges the severity of the situation but maintains composure and leadership presence.
Does not engage in futile blame or emotional outbursts, instead encourages pragmatic survival strategy.
Responds to Saavik with a hopeful statement about possibilities.
Turns away, overcome, when confronted by Carol about their separation and his son.
Hesitates but then sits next to Chekov and changes Bones' compress, showing care despite emotional difficulty.
Remains silent when Carol presses him to share his feelings about their situation.
Hesitates but chooses to trust Carol and takes her hand to follow her to the tunnel, showing some vulnerability and willingness to accept help.
Races ahead excitedly toward the light at the end of the tunnel, expressing eagerness and an open, childlike enthusiasm.
Hesitates briefly before accepting Carol's hand and follows her to the Genesis Cave, showing some initial doubt but ultimately taking action.
Races ahead excitedly through the tunnel toward the source of light, demonstrating confidence and eagerness in exploring unknown territory.
Stops at the entrance of the Genesis Cave, mouth dropping open in awe at the vast and beautiful environment, indicating a moment of awe and wonder but no loss of control or error.
Shares a meal with others in a relaxed setting, puts down his food to engage.

Kirk calmly shares a moment of normalcy and camaraderie during a tense situation (eating fruit with companions on Genesis) and interacts with others confidently (putting down his food and commenting).
No direct decisive action or command observed in this excerpt; appears somewhat passive, allowing others to lead or observe events without interjecting.
Engages in conversation with Saavik, patiently answering her questions about the Kobayashi Maru test.
Admits to reprogramming the no-win scenario to make it possible to win.
Expresses a competitive nature: 'I don't like to lose.'
Addresses his crew and coordinates calmly and respectfully.
Reprogrammed the no-win Kobayashi Maru test to create a possible victory, receiving commendation for original thinking.
Admits to altering the test scenario rather than facing an impossible challenge as intended.
Responds confidently and decisively in communication, coordinating with Spock for timely beam-up.
Greets Spock warmly and engages in light teasing with Saavik about following regulations.
Focuses on practical problem-solving and remains calm under pressure while guiding others through the ship.
Orders 'Battle stations' promptly and engages tactically with crew and officers.
Shares a faint smile and amused glance with Spock despite tension.
Issues cautious but respectful orders to Scotty without harshness ('No promises, Mr. Scott').
Immediately orders battle stations and tactical readiness upon arrival on the bridge, showing decisiveness and command presence.
Considers tactical options (Mutara Nebula) despite known risks, assessing feasibility with Scotty.
Recognizes limitations and capabilities of the ship (energizer bypassed), balancing risk and feasibility.
Shares a knowing, amused look with Spock regarding the mutual hazards of the nebula, showing confidence and morale management.
Uses informal, colloquial language ('Uh oh') showing a casual or nonchalant attitude despite potential danger, could reflect overconfidence or lightheartedness in crisis.
Exchanges a meaningful look with Spock before responding, indicating a shared understanding and camaraderie.
Replies to Spock's dry comment with a casual 'Best speed, Scotty...', showing informal friendliness and trust among crew.
Responds with calm leadership during high-pressure pursuit by Reliant, showing steadiness but no explicit warmth.
Unfazed by enemy fire, maintains composure and calmly responds to a dangerous situation.
Challenges Khan with a mixture of confidence and humor, attempting to defuse tension through taunt.
Makes a dry, somewhat sarcastic comment about an opponent's consistency.
Calmly assesses tactical situation and gives firing order despite technological difficulties.
Commands Sulu to fire and maintains composure under electrical disturbance
Encourages crew to hold course and look sharp despite unclear situation
Issues evasive orders decisively during attack
Commands phaser fire immediately after ship is hit
Offers to have Chekov man the weapons console despite Chekov being faint, accepting his help.
Immediately checks on damage and listens to crew reports (Scotty, Chekov, Spock) calmly and respectfully.
Orders phaser bank one to fire immediately after explosion, quickly assesses damage and decides to run on auxiliary power when main power is compromised.
Delegates weapons console operation to faint Chekov, effectively utilizing available crew despite conditions.
Questions Spock about enemy's tactics and intentions, showing active strategic thinking and reliance on data.
Does not show any hesitation or panic during ship damage and battle situation, maintains command composure.
Looks at Saavik and smiles before giving clear, precise commands.
Engages in battle by ordering to fire on Reliant, showing tactical decisiveness but no indication of emotional warmth in this interaction.
Orders an all stop and descent followed by preparing photon torpedoes, indicating tactical forethought and confidence.
Executes a surprise attack by maneuvering Enterprise above and behind Reliant and firing photon torpedoes that effectively disable the enemy ship's weapons and engines.
Ceases fire promptly and orders careful, professional response rather than reckless aggression.
Orders rescue or boarding of damaged enemy ship rather than destruction, showing respect for life and procedure.
Maintains a professional and calm demeanor despite high tension and uncertainty.
Fails to show immediate personal concern or emotional response to Khan's grievous condition and threats.
Ceases fire and orders careful assessment of power levels after battle damage, showing measured control over the situation.
Orders Scotty to restore mains power despite difficult radiation conditions, demonstrating confidence in engineering abilities and maintaining command presence.
Commands Uhura to send boarding orders to the enemy ship despite uncertain enemy status, taking decisive action to regain control.
Decides to beam aboard the Reliant after no response to orders, preparing for further engagement rather than giving up, showing resourcefulness and initiative.
Urgently inquires about engine room status under pressure to save the ship and crew.
Acknowledges Scotty's repair work with gratitude, saying 'Bless you, Scotty.'
Turns to Carol and acknowledges the importance of their son Carl with evident concern, 'Reduce speed. My God, Carl. Look at it...'
Kirk shows deep grief and sorrow at Spock's death, tears streaming down his face, reflecting sincere emotional pain and connection.
Kirk reflexively places his hand to match Spock's on the other side of the glass, a tender gesture showing compassion and closeness.
Kirk delivers a solemn ship's burial service speech honoring the dead, acknowledging sacrifice and promoting respect and shared mourning.
Kirk appears unable to respond to new life discovery due to overwhelming grief, momentarily isolating himself from hopeful news.
Struggles emotionally while speaking about his lost friend, falters and is unable to continue due to Bones' tears.
Shows respect and solemnity during the commemorative ceremony for Spock, quietly signaling for the bagpipe to start and participating fully in the ritual.
Gives clear, considerate orders to Saavik, speaks quietly indicating trust and deference to her role after dismissing the company.
Expresses sincere apology to David for his friends' deaths.
Accepts David's apology and pride, and openly hugs his son, holding on as if to life itself.
Introduces his son to Saavik with gentle humor and ease, allowing a lighthearted moment despite seriousness.
Makes an effort to listen and engage thoughtfully with David despite emotional tension.
Responds empathetically and openly with his son, showing emotional intelligence.
Maintains confident command presence entering the bridge and interacting with crew.
Use of informal humor and casual tone when introducing his son to Saavik might risk undermining authority, but is tolerated and well-received.
Remembers Spock’s message on his birthday and shares it quietly with others.
Responds to Bones’ concern with a sincere and positive smile, saying he feels young.
Gives a playful, imaginative new course order to Saavik and David.
Quotes a thoughtful and meaningful phrase reflecting self-awareness and growth, calmly assigns a new course to the ship's lieutenant.
Responds positively to inquiry about his condition, demonstrating emotional resilience.
